item.title: FAQ
item.content:encoded:
Can't find an answer? Get in touch.

Shipping        Returns        Lifetime Guarantee

Shipping

We ship in the UK with Royal Mail Signed-For, which will in the vast majority of circumstances deliver in three working days. For international deliveries we typically use Fedex International Priority, which typically takes around 5-10 working days. Both companies give us a tracking number which we will pass on to you in the order receipt.

Returns

If the rucksack is returned as-new within 28 days of purchase we will give a full refund on the retail price, though the shipping is non-refundable. The return address is

Hawthorn Rucksacks Ltd
41 Princess May Road
London
N16 8DF

Lifetime Guarantee

We are so confident in our build quality that all Hawthorn Rucksacks come with a lifetime guarantee against manufacturing faults. This means that if any part of the rucksack fails beyond that expected from normal wear and tear we will give you a brand new one. As with all luggage guarantees, `lifetime' applies to the product not the wearer, which is typically 5-10 years of daily use. 

We do not expect these problems to arise as we have taken every care in our manufacture, but if for some reason a rucksack does fall short please send it back to the address above with a short note explaining what went wrong. We will verify the damage and send over a new bag free of charge or, if someone has clearly run over the bag with a lawnmower or tried to hang a rhino from the zip, get in touch to discuss repairs.

item.title: Colour sold out?
item.content:encoded:
Colour you love sold out? New stock soon!

Our rucksacks are built by hand to last a lifetime at our workshop in East London. If you leave your email address we will send you a one time email when your colour is back.

Sign up for Hawthorn Quarterly?

Thank you! We will be in touch when your colour is back in stock!

item.title: Our Story
item.content:encoded:
The rucksack is a classic design, but it has a flaw- it can be opened by anyone, behind the wearer's back! Consoling a friend who had his laptop stolen on a busy train, Tom had the thought "what if the rucksack closed on your back?". That way, when the rucksack is worn, the zip is hidden and your possessions are protected.

The first ever Hawthorn Rucksack was made on sewing machine in a living room, from green vinyl and brown wool, with a vertical zip on the back panel. Whilst the contents were protected, we didn't like the design- modern rucksacks have to store laptops, but with a vertical zip, the laptop had to be taken out every time the rucksack was opened. A new design was needed.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="2416.0"] The 2016 Hawthorn Original in Olive. [/caption] [caption id="" align="alignnone" width="258.0"] A first prototype, made on a home sewing machine, just after Easter 2013. We found the vertical zip didn't allow easy laptop storage. [/caption]

Our flagship product,  Hawthorn Original, is the solution. The result of two years' designing, refining, sourcing, prototyping and road testing until we made a rucksack we couldn't break. We realised that the zip can be placed horizontally, underneath the straps. Our unique design closes onto the back of the wearer, providing unrivalled protection against theft, whilst still allowing full functionality with open access, internal pockets and easy laptop storage.

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="1500.0"] Our unique design allows easy access whilst offering unrivalled protection against theft. [/caption]  

Making a Hawthorn

In an age where the quality and welfare of manufacture is hidden more than ever, we are proud that our rucksacks are constructed to the highest specifications by our experienced team in the east end of London. We take pains to have a close relationship with our suppliers, using materials coming from the UK or through UK-based stockists who guarantee the welfare of manufacture. Our waxed canvas is made by Halley Stevensons in Dundee, who have been producing nothing but the highest quality waxed canvas since 1864, originally as sailcloth. Our organic cotton lining is supplied the Organic Textile Company in Machynlleth who work in ethical collaboration with their partners and weavers in Kerala. We only use luggage grade YKK zips and the finest brass hardware, as high quality components are essential. A Hawthorn Rucksack is made with pride and honesty, to the highest standards. See the full range.

item.title: Hawthorn Rucksacks
item.content:encoded:
Hawthorn Rucksacks stop pickpockets through our unique design.

The secret? By placing the zip to close on your back, you protect your possessions simply by wearing the rucksack, giving ultimate peace of mind whilst commuting or travelling at home and abroad.

Our unique waxed canvas and leather rucksacks are made in London
from the finest materials. After extensive prototyping and stress-testing, our latest generation are built to last a lifetime. 

Check out our 2015 Lookbook

Please get in touch if you have any questions, we would love to hear from you.

item.content:encoded:

Our unique anti-theft design closes on your back, keeping your possessions secure.

After extensive prototyping and stress-testing, our latest generation are built to last a lifetime.
